result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea. The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. 
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing. 
Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has completed the TAD evaluation and has not received a DPA from the State.
DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
All parties appear via zoom.  Pretrial Conference held.  Defense received discovery, offer and requests a DPA hearing.  Defendant has TAD eval scheduled for July 8, 2022.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson
Current: 6923 N Teutonia Apt 4, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 05-07-2022)
Prior: 1817 South 16th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Donaven Dwayne Lamont Jefferson not in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/1/22 @ 1:30p
